data.meta_description: 【Solved】Click here to get an answer to your question: COMPREHENSION QUESTIONS: Which genre does Smaller and Smaller Circles fit into? A. It is a mystery, crime thriller book. C. It is a short story about ...
data.text:
COMPREHENSION QUESTIONS: Which genre does Smaller and Smaller Circles fit into? A. It is a mystery, crime thriller book. C. It is a short story about a family. B. It is a romantic comedy novel. D. It is a poem about a young boy and his killer. What is the setting of story? A. Payatas, 1990 s B, Quiapo, 1980 s C. Tondo, 1970 s D. Manila, 1960 s The book Smaller and Smaller Circles was written as a social commentary to injustice and inequality. Based on the review, what is the central message of this book? A. Depravity B. horror c. jealousy D. love GRADE 10 READING MATERIAL FOR VALIDATION The book review talks about two Jesuit priests investigating the murders of young boys by a serid killer. What is the possible connection of the priests to the children in Payatos dumpsite? A. The priests are the legal guardians of the children. B. The priests are the killers of these children. C. The priests are the benefactors of the children. D. The priests are the parents of the children. Based from the genre, who is the intended audience of this book? A. This book is appropriate for adolescent readers. B. This book is appropriate for young readers. C. This book is appropriate for adult readers. D. This book is appropriate for teenage readers. What can you infer from the phrase "o parent's sacrifice of their child's well-being in the hope of avoiding conflict with the authorities"? A. Some parents would rather hide their children's criminal activities. B. Some parents would rather keep quiet than report a crime because of fear. C. Some parents distrust the authorities, so they do not report any crime done towards their children. D. Some parents do not like involving the authorities, so they prefer to exact their personal revenge to their child's tormentor. Based on the review, how would one describe the police in the book? A. The police are indifferent to injustice. C. The police are the root of injustice. B. The police are eager to fight injustice. D. The police are clueless about injustice. Which issues are highlighted in the book review? A. the political activity of the community C. the economic condition of the community B. the technological state of the community D. the socio-economic issues in the community Which information about the book review is false? A. The book confirms that love and bravery conquer all problems and challenges in life even when there is adversity. B. The book emphasizes the complex elements that drive the upper and lower class to pursue their own justice. C. The book underscores the different societal issues that push the marginalized to commit a crime. D. The book shows the extent of societal damage inflicted to the weok and innocent due to the indifference of the authority. What does the title of the book, Smaller and Smaller Circles, imply? A. It explains how corruption can make someone feel neglected. B. It reflects the oppressive feeling of someone who is cornered. C. It describes how someone feels when confronted about a wrongdoing. D. It shows what happens when someone is dizzy and goes around in circles.

143
